keep-what-you-need-delete-the-rest.original: Keep what you need. Delete the rest.
keep-what-you-need-delete-the-rest.value: Behalten Sie, was Sie brauchen. Den Rest löschen.

static:hero-subheading-home-1.original: A starting point for developers looking to build a multilingual website with Astro and Rosey, using Bookshop components in CloudCannon. CloudCannon provides a UI for non-technical editors to enter translations. Create your own copy, and start creating your own components to use in the CloudCannon CMS.
static:hero-subheading-home-1.value: Ein Ausgangspunkt für Entwickler, die mit Astro und Rosey eine mehrsprachige Website erstellen möchten und dabei Bookshop-Komponenten in CloudCannon verwenden. CloudCannon bietet eine Benutzeroberfläche für technisch nicht versierte Redakteure zum Eingeben von Übersetzungen. Erstellen Sie Ihre eigene Kopie und beginnen Sie mit der Erstellung Ihrer eigenen Komponenten zur Verwendung im CloudCannon CMS.

static:left-right-text-home-1.original:
To help save you time, some features are set up in this template, like:

  • Bookshop
  • Blog with pagination and tags
  • Image optimization
  • SEO Controls
  • Responsive header and footer
  • Font Awesome Icons
  • Schemas for adding new pages
  • Editable color pallete
  • Markdown styles
  • CloudCannon configuration
  • CSS variables
static:left-right-text-home-1.value:
Um Ihnen Zeit zu sparen, sind in dieser Vorlage einige Funktionen eingerichtet, wie zum Beispiel:

  • Bookshop
  • Blog mit Paginierung, Tags und <a href="https://docs.astro.build/en/guides/markdown-content/#using-components-in-mdx" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Snippets</a>
  • <a href="https://docs.astro.build/en/guides/images/#image--astroassets" target="_blank" rel="noopener">Bildoptimierung</a>
  • SEO-Kontrollen
  • Responsive Kopf- und Fußzeile
  • Font Awesome Symbole
  • Schemata zum Hinzufügen neuer Seiten
  • Bearbeitbare Farbpalette
  • Markdown-Stile
  • CloudCannon-Konfiguration
  • CSS-Variablen

static:/blog/email-delivery-tips/.original:
When you send an email campaign, you expect it to reach your readers, right? But what if the emails go straight to your subscribers’ spam folders instead of their inboxes? To make sure your emails reach their recipients successfully, follow these email delivery tips.

Use an ESP

Use an email service provider (ESP) that has been tested by third-party email certification services. This ensures that your emails will be accepted by the major ISPs. An ESP that offers multiple IP addresses, or one that allows you to use your own IP address if necessary. ISPs often block messages from unknown senders, so having your own IP address helps get around this issue.

Be aware of what’s normal for your target customers’ inboxes. If you’re sending out emails to people who are on Gmail and Yahoo accounts, then there’s little chance they’ll get blocked because their addresses haven’t been flagged as spam yet. But if you’re reaching out to people with Outlook or AOL addresses, there’s a good chance your message will get flagged as junk mail and end up in their spam folder before they ever see it. Make sure you’re testing different types of addresses before sending out any mass marketing campaigns.

Double opt-in

Before you send out any campaign using an email marketing tool, make sure that you have permission from your subscribers to send them emails. You can do this by asking them during signup or including a checkbox in the subscription form asking if they’d like to receive marketing communications from you in the future.

Use double opt-in when sending out marketing emails. This means that the recipient must have previously agreed to receive emails from you before they can see content in their inboxes or on their mobile devices. This helps prevent people from signing up for newsletters they don’t want and can help protect against spam complaints from users who didn’t know they had signed up for something in the first place.

Keep your content short and sweet

Your customers don’t want to read lengthy emails full of text, so keep your messages short and sweet. If you have multiple products to promote, break up each product offer into its own email instead of sending one page-long message with multiple links embedded in it. That way, customers can easily find what they’re looking for without having to scroll all over the page.

Use images sparingly (if at all). You might be tempted to include an image in every email you send out, but it’s important to remember that images can cause problems when it comes to inbox delivery — particularly when they’re used incorrectly or included in bulk emails from companies where the receiver doesn’t know who sent them. If you’re going

Tracking

Choose a reliable ESP that allows you to track opens and clicks so you can figure out which types of messages work best for your audience.

Send your best email

So, remember to keep this in mind and to always know that if you are sending out emails related to your business, be sure to follow-up with customers or clients and make sure that they are getting their emails in a timely manner.

If you’re going

Tracking

Choose a reliable ESP that allows you to track opens and clicks so you can figure out which types of messages work best for your audience.

Send your best email

So, remember to keep this in mind and to always know that if you are sending out emails related to your business, be sure to follow-up with customers or clients and make sure that they are getting their emails in a timely manner.

static:/blog/a-test-page/.original:
All you have to learn here is how to have fun. Just pretend you are a whisper floating across a mountain. You have to make almighty decisions when you’re the creator. There we are.

We’ll throw some old gray clouds in here just sneaking around and having fun. Only eight colors that you need. This is the fun part Put it in, leave it alone. Get away from those little Christmas tree things we used to make in school.

code:
  an_object_key:
    options: {}
    another_thing:
      - an array item
      - another array item

Take your time. Speed will come later. You can bend rivers. But when I get home, the only thing I have power over is the garbage. Let’s get wild today. If you don’t think every day is a good day - try missing a few. You’ll see. Play with the angles. We don’t have to be committed. We are just playing here.

Another code block:

<div>
  <h1>This is a test for HTML code blocks</h1>
  <p>A paragraph</p>
</div>

Mix your color marbly don’t mix it dead. Trees cover up a multitude of sins. The only prerequisite is that it makes you happy. If it makes you happy then it’s good. When you do it your way you can go anywhere you choose. We’ll have a super time. Don’t fiddle with it all day.

We have all at one time or another mixed some mud. It’s beautiful - and we haven’t even done anything to it yet. Let’s make some happy little clouds in our world. Let your heart be your guide.

We have a fantastic little sky! We’re trying to teach you a technique here and how to use it.
static:/blog/a-test-page/.value:
Hier müssen Sie nur lernen, wie man Spaß hat. Stellen Sie sich einfach vor, Sie wären ein Flüstern, das über einen Berg schwebt. Als <sup>Schöpfer</sup> musst du allmächtige <sub>Entscheidungen</sub> treffen. Da sind wir.

Wir werfen hier ein paar alte graue Wolken rein, schleichen einfach herum und haben Spaß. Nur acht Farben, die Sie brauchen. Das ist der lustige Teil. Setzen Sie es ein und lassen Sie es in Ruhe. Weg von den kleinen Weihnachtsbaum-Sachen, die wir in der Schule gebastelt haben.

code:
  an_object_key:
    options:
    another_thing:
      - an array item
      - another array item

Lass dir Zeit. Geschwindigkeit kommt später. Sie können Flüsse biegen. Aber wenn ich nach Hause komme, ist das Einzige, worüber ich Macht habe, der Müll. Lasst uns heute wild werden. Wenn Sie nicht glauben, dass jeder Tag ein guter Tag ist, versuchen Sie, ein paar zu verpassen. Du wirst sehen. Spielen Sie mit den Winkeln. Wir müssen uns nicht verpflichten. Wir spielen hier nur.

Ein weiterer Codeblock:

<div>
  <h1>This is a test for HTML code blocks</h1>
  <p>A paragraph</p>
</div>

Mischen Sie Ihre Farbe marmoriert, nicht tot. Bäume verdecken eine Vielzahl von Sünden. Die einzige Voraussetzung ist, dass es glücklich macht. Wenn es dich glücklich macht, dann ist es gut. Wenn Sie es auf Ihre Weise tun, können Sie überall hingehen, wo Sie möchten. Wir werden eine super Zeit haben. Spielen Sie nicht den ganzen Tag damit herum.

Wir haben alle schon einmal etwas Schlamm angerührt. Es ist wunderschön – und wir haben noch nicht einmal etwas daran gemacht. Lasst uns ein paar glückliche kleine Wolken in unsere Welt bringen. Lassen Sie sich von Ihrem Herzen leiten. Wir haben einen fantastischen kleinen Himmel!

Some tint text. Wir versuchen Ihnen hier eine Technik und deren Anwendung beizubringen.
